page.description: Fires after the user is authenticated. The event fires regardless of whether the authentication was successful or not. The e.loginSucceeded flag indicates if the login was successful or not. An important use of this event is to force a reload of the component on login. See the discussion below on 'Forcing a Reload of the UX Component After Login' for more details. This event can also be used to set the 'friendly user name'. The 'friendly user name' is made available in client-side 'afterLogin' event. It can also be used in client-side watch expressions.

item.name: e.username
item.description: user name entered by user to log in

item.name: e.loginSucceeded
item.description: either .t. or .f. depending on whether the user was successfully logged in or not.

item.name: e.flagUserWasAlreadyLoggedIn
item.description: if the user was already logged in when the page was initially loaded, this flag is .t.

section.description: Your event handler can set these variables

item.name: e.userNameFriendly
item.description: This is the value that will be used in the 'FriendlyName' property passed to the client-side 'afterLogin' event.

item.name: e.javascript
item.description: any Javascript you want to execute

item.name: e.url
item.description: (optional) the target URL after a sucessful login. TIP: To reload the current component after a sucessful login, set e.url to '<thisComponent>'
